page.title: 06 BIRDS OF THE AREA
page.content: We have recorded the birds seen in our playing field.In the winter we saw crows,magpies,mistle thrushes, lapwings,jackdaws,seagulls,robins, starlings,blackbirds,sparrows and redwings.Additionally in the summer we saw pied wagtails,chaffinches, house-martins and swallows. An area south of the school on the Severn Estuary has been designated a "site of special scientific interest".Access is by public footpath from B4239 and along sea_wall. It is a winter feeding area for dunlin,knot,redshank,ringed plover, shoverler scaup and scoter. A wide variety of birds occurs on passage. Garganey,whimbred,wood sandpiper, little ringed plover ruff and little stint may be seen.
